meta.content: Q&A with State Superintendent Chris Reykdal during the COVID-19 pandemic

This is a message from Washington State Superintendent Chris Reykdal to educators, parents, students, & seniors. For guidance and resources related to COVID-19 and public schools in Washington state, please visit https://k12.wa.us/covid-19.

div.h1: Q&A with State Superintendent Chris Reykdal during the COVID-19 pandemic

article.class: post post-14740 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-cms category-district category-gha category-lintott-elementary category-lca category-orin-smith category-wf-west

div.h2: Q&A with State Superintendent Chris Reykdal during the COVID-19 pandemic

div.div: admin2020-04-08T15:45:09-07:00April 4th, 2020|Chehalis Middle School, Chehalis School District, Green Hill Academy, James W. Lintott Elementary, Lewis County Alternative School, Orin C. Smith Elementary, W.F. West High School|

div.p: This is a message from Washington State Superintendent Chris Reykdal to educators, parents, students, & seniors. For guidance and resources related to COVID-19 and public schools in Washington state, please visit https://k12.wa.us/covid-19.

div.p: If you are unable to access any information or functionality provided on this website, please email the District Office at comments@chehalisschools.org or call (360) 807-7200 for assistance.

div.class: pum pum-overlay pum-theme-14730 pum-theme-cutting-edge popmake-overlay auto_open click_open
pum-container popmake theme-14730 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
div.div: All schools CLOSED through the end of the school year

p.strong: All Chehalis School District schools will be closed through the end of the school year. Distance learning will continue.

div.p: During the school closure, grab and go meals will be offered for anyone ages 18 and under at no cost, from Mon.-Fri., 11:00 am to 1:00 pm.
We expect to prepare 500 meals on the first day of service and will adjust our figures on future days based on participation.
